availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Boston, Massachusetts, major general. Boston, Massachusetts, native. Son of David S. Townsend. Married to Ann Townsend. Father of Thomas Townsend, Edward Townsend, and Henrietta Townsend. Graduate of the United States Military Academy at West Point, New York, in 1837. Served in the 2nd United States Artillery as second lieutenant, first lieutenant, captain, and adjutant. Transferred to the Adjutant General's Corps and assigned to duty in Washington, D.C. in 1846. Lieutenant colonel and colonel. Brevetted brigadier general on September 24, 1864. Brevetted major general on March 13, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Washington, D.C., Washington County, Ward 1, p. 65.
"Obituary, Gen. Edward D. Townsend," New York Times (New York), May 12, 1893, p. 5.
Appletons' Cyclopedia of American Biography, vol. VI, (New York: D. Appleton and Company, 1889), p. 147.
